https://cmr.earthdata.nasa.gov/search/co.Description: The Global Fire WEather Database (GFWED) integrates different weather factors that influence the likelihood of a fire starting, spreading, or behaving in a particularly dangerous way. The database is used by fire managers, researchers, and policymakers to identify periods of the year and locations that are at increased risk for fires. The GFWED dataset is a part of the NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center (SEDAC) and is available for download. The dataset includes information on temperature, humidity, precipitation, and wind speed.

The Global Fire WEather Database (GFWED) integrates different weather factors that influence the likelihood of a fire starting, spreading, or behaving in a particularly dangerous way. The database is used by fire managers, researchers, and policymakers to identify periods of the year and locations that are at increased risk for fires. The database can also be used to identify how fire weather may change in the future.
